title: Cap Streamers, 1700–50
provenance: Purchased in 1845 in Italy by Richard C. Greenleaf's maternal grandmother, and stated as each having inspired Richard Cranch Greenleaf's collection.
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Pair of needle lace cap streamers with an asymmetrical floral pattern, with scalloped edges formed by curving leaves.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cap Streamers, 1700–50.
1700–50. Medium: linen
Technique: needle lace. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-2-a,b.
